AODCore.camera

The camera has two important factors: position and size.
The position is at which point the screen will render (the origin is at the center of the screen).
The size is the diameter of the rendered area.

Example:
  // To render a 640x480 area at origin
  AOD.Camera.Set_Position(0,     0);
  AOD.Camera.Set_Size    (640, 480);


void Set_Position(Vector pos);
Sets the position of the camera

Params:
Vector pos position of the camera relative to origin (0, 0)

void Set_Position(float x, float y);
Sets the position of the camera

Params:
float x position of the camera on the x-axis relative to origin
float x position of the camera on the y-axis relative to origin

void Set_Size(Vector siz);
Sets the size of the camera ( the screen renders )

Params:
Vector siz dimension of the camera in pixels

void Set_Size(float x, float y);
Sets the size of the camera

Params:
float x dimension of the camera on the x-axis in pixels
float y dimension of the camera on the y-axis in pixels

Vector R_Size();
Returns the size of the camera

Vector R_Position();
Returns the position of the camera

Vector R_Origin_Offset();
Returns the position of the screen if the origin were to be at the top-left of the screen
